gw.api.testdata

Class TestDataUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.testdata.TestDataUtil

  • public class TestDataUtil
extends Object
    Utilities for use in tests that need to manipulate beans, bundles, locales, and other data. Do not use these methods in production code. Many of them make assumptions about the test environment and all of them are subject to change without notice.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void commitBundleIgnoreAllRules(Bundle bundle)
      Commit the bundle with no rules - pre update, validation and messaging rules will all be disabled. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void commitBundleIgnoreMessageGeneration(Bundle bundle)
      Commit the bundle with message generation turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void commitBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules(Bundle bundle)
      Commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void commitBundleWithoutValidation(Bundle bundle)
      Commit the bundle without performing validation. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static Bundle createBundle()
      Create a new, empty bundle
      static KeyableBean createEntity(Bundle bundle, String typeName, Map<String,Object> fieldValues)
      Creates a new entity of the named type in the given bundle and populates it with the given field values. This is not intended for normal entities, which can be constructed more easily using builders or the standard Gosu object initialization syntax. But it can be useful for building entities of a type that is not known in the current Gosu context - for example if you're writing a test with an IncludeModules tag that introduces new types.
      static Bundle createNonPersistentBundle()
      Returns a bundle that should not be comitted (i.e., will throw an exception if it is).
      static boolean doesEntityExist(String entityName)
      Tests for the existance of an entity by looking for the table by name.
      static void flushGlobalCache()
      Flushes the global cache.
      static Key getMaxIdFor(IEntityType type)
      Return the current maximum committed id for the given entity type. Useful in single threaded tests, for finding all "new" items committed after the current time (you find the max id, do the operation, then find all items where the id is greater than the old max id). This approach doesn't work in multi threaded or clustered environments, when ids can be interleaved.
      static void refreshBundle(Bundle bundle)
      Refreshs the bundle.
      static T reload(T bean)
      Reload the given bean from the global cache. The bean must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception. The reloaded bean will be returned in a read-only bundle.
      static T reloadFromDatabase(T bean)
      Reload the given bean from the database, bypassing the global cache. The bean must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception. The global cache is NOT updated with the returned bean.
      static List<T> reloadInOrder(List<T> beans)
      Reload the given list of beans from the global cache. The beans must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception
      static void runAsUser(User user, Runnable block)
      Run the given block as the given user. Note that this may not do what you expect in a smoke test. In a smoke test there are often two "current" users, the user running the test code and the user logged into the web UI. This method just affects the user running the test code - so it will affect builder calls, for example. It will not affect who is logged into the web UI; to do that you have to log out the smoke test and login again with a different user
      static void runInLanguage(String languageTypeCode, Runnable block)
      Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
      static void runInLanguageAndLocale(String languageTypeCode, String localeTypeCode, Runnable block)
      Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
      static void runInLocale(String localeTypeCode, Runnable block)
      Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
      static void runWithExistingBundleNoCommit(Bundle bundle, Runnable block)
      Set the given bundle as the current thread local bundle provider for the duration of the given block. This allows Gosu to use the bundle as the "implicit" bundle used in no argument constructors e.g. var claim = new Claim() uses the implicit bundle. This method does not commit the given bundle.
      static void runWithNewBundleIgnoreAllRules(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
      Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with no rules enables - pre update, validation and messaging rules will all be disabled. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void runWithNewBundleIgnoreMessageGeneration(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
      Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with message generation turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void runWithNewBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
      Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static void runWithNewBundleWithoutValidation(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
      Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
      static T waitForChange(T bean, Predicate<T> isChanged, long timeout)
      Waits for a change to a specific entity. If the change occurs within the given timout, returns the updated entity. Otherwise call Assert.fail.
      static T waitForVersion(T bean, int minVersion, long timeout)
      Wait for an entity's version to change to the given version value (or exceed it). If this happens within the given timeout, return the updated entity. Otherwise call Assert.fail.

        void commitBundleIgnoreAllRules(Bundle bundle)
        Commit the bundle with no rules - pre update, validation and messaging rules will all be disabled. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to commit

      • commitBundleIgnoreMessageGeneration

        Commit the bundle with message generation turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to commit

      • commitBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules

        void commitBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules(Bundle bundle)
        Commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:

      • createBundle

        Bundle createBundle()
        Create a new, empty bundle
        Returns:
        the new bundle

      • createEntity

        KeyableBean createEntity(Bundle bundle,
                       String typeName,
                       Map<String,Object> fieldValues)
        Creates a new entity of the named type in the given bundle and populates it with the given field values. This is not intended for normal entities, which can be constructed more easily using builders or the standard Gosu object initialization syntax. But it can be useful for building entities of a type that is not known in the current Gosu context - for example if you're writing a test with an IncludeModules tag that introduces new types.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle in which to create the new entity
        typeName - the name of the type of the entity
        fieldValues - the values of the entity fields, as a map of field names to values. There is no type checking on these values and they will be used as is. So, for example, type keys should be given in full, TypeListName.TC_XX rather than as just "xx".
        Returns:
        the newly created entity

      • createNonPersistentBundle

        Bundle createNonPersistentBundle()
        Returns a bundle that should not be comitted (i.e., will throw an exception if it is).
        Returns:
        The non-persistent bundle

      • doesEntityExist

        boolean doesEntityExist(String entityName)
        Tests for the existance of an entity by looking for the table by name.
        Parameters:
        entityName - The entity name (not fully qualified)
        Returns:
        True if entity/table exists, false otherwise

      • flushGlobalCache

        void flushGlobalCache()
        Flushes the global cache.

      • getMaxIdFor

        Key getMaxIdFor(IEntityType type)
        Return the current maximum committed id for the given entity type. Useful in single threaded tests, for finding all "new" items committed after the current time (you find the max id, do the operation, then find all items where the id is greater than the old max id). This approach doesn't work in multi threaded or clustered environments, when ids can be interleaved.
        Parameters:
        type - the entity type
        Returns:
        the maximum id for the type; returns a key with value zero of no entities of that type have been committed

      • refreshBundle

        void refreshBundle(Bundle bundle)
        Refreshs the bundle.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to refresh

      • reload

        T reload(T bean)
        Reload the given bean from the global cache. The bean must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception. The reloaded bean will be returned in a read-only bundle.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to be reloaded
        Returns:
        a new copy of the bean, freshly loaded from the global cache

      • reloadFromDatabase

        T reloadFromDatabase(T bean)
        Reload the given bean from the database, bypassing the global cache. The bean must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception. The global cache is NOT updated with the returned bean.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to be reloaded
        Returns:
        a new copy of the bean, freshly loaded from the database

      • reloadInOrder

        List<T> reloadInOrder(List<T> beans)
        Reload the given list of beans from the global cache. The beans must have been committed to the database, or this method will throw an exception
        Parameters:
        beans - the beans to be reloaded
        Returns:
        a list containings new copies of the original beans, freshly loaded from the global cache. The order of the beans in the new list will match the order in the original list

      • runAsUser

        void runAsUser(User user,
             Runnable block)
        Run the given block as the given user. Note that this may not do what you expect in a smoke test. In a smoke test there are often two "current" users, the user running the test code and the user logged into the web UI. This method just affects the user running the test code - so it will affect builder calls, for example. It will not affect who is logged into the web UI; to do that you have to log out the smoke test and login again with a different user
        Parameters:
        user - the user, must not be null
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runInLanguage

        void runInLanguage(String languageTypeCode,
                 Runnable block)
        Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
        Parameters:
        languageTypeCode - the code of the language type associated with the desired language
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runInLanguageAndLocale

                          String localeTypeCode,
                          Runnable block)
        Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
        Parameters:
        languageTypeCode - the code of the language type associated with the desired language
        localeTypeCode -
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runInLocale

        void runInLocale(String localeTypeCode,
               Runnable block)
        Run the given block in the locale specified by the given language type code. This gives a way to set localized fields, such as the subject of an activity pattern.
        Parameters:
        localeTypeCode - the code of the language type associated with the desired locale
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runWithExistingBundleNoCommit

        void runWithExistingBundleNoCommit(Bundle bundle,
                                 Runnable block)
        Set the given bundle as the current thread local bundle provider for the duration of the given block. This allows Gosu to use the bundle as the "implicit" bundle used in no argument constructors e.g. var claim = new Claim() uses the implicit bundle. This method does not commit the given bundle.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to be used as the current bundle
        block - the block of code to run with the given bundle as the current bundle

      • runWithNewBundleIgnoreAllRules

        void runWithNewBundleIgnoreAllRules(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with no rules enables - pre update, validation and messaging rules will all be disabled. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runWithNewBundleIgnoreMessageGeneration

        void runWithNewBundleIgnoreMessageGeneration(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with message generation turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runWithNewBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules

        void runWithNewBundleIgnorePreUpdateRules(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • runWithNewBundleWithoutValidation

        void runWithNewBundleWithoutValidation(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Run the given block with a new bundle and then commit the bundle with pre update rules turned off. Only intended for tests and importing sample data, not for general use.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute, must not be null

      • waitForChange

        T waitForChange(T bean,
              Predicate<T> isChanged,
              long timeout)
        Waits for a change to a specific entity. If the change occurs within the given timout, returns the updated entity. Otherwise call Assert.fail.
        Parameters:
        bean - the entity that is supposed to change
        isChanged - a predicate whose evaluate method should return true when the expected change has occurred on the entity
        timeout - the time to wait before failing
        Returns:
        the changed version of the entity, in a readonly bundle

      • waitForVersion

        T waitForVersion(T bean,
               int minVersion,
               long timeout)
        Wait for an entity's version to change to the given version value (or exceed it). If this happens within the given timeout, return the updated entity. Otherwise call Assert.fail.
        Parameters:
        bean - the entity whose version is supposed to change
        minVersion - the minimum version value which the entity must reach
        timeout - the time to wait before failing
        Returns:
        the changed version of the entity, in a readonly bundle
